alert.note: Alert for Salt Lake (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 16 at 9:43AM MDT until April 19 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Utah... Emigration Creek Salt Lake City`s East Bench affecting Salt Lake County. .Warm temperatures Sunday and Monday and rain on snow Tuesday will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For Emigration Creek...including Salt Lake City`s East Bench... action stage is forecast. Flood stage is possible Monday night into Tuesday morning and again Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Emigration Creek Near Salt Lake City. * WHEN...From this evening to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 130 CFS, minor flood damage will impact homes and structures along the stream, including areas of the Hogle Zoo. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Current flow is 34 CFS and rising. - Forecast...Emigration Creek is forecast to peak between 9 PM Sunday and 4 AM Monday 125 CFS, above action stage. The current forecast peak between 9 PM Monday and 8 AM Tuesday will reach 140 CFS, which is above flood flow. Another peak above flood stage is forecast Tuesday night into Wednesday morning. - Action flow is 110 cfs. - Flood flow is 130 cfs. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM MDT.
